Posts.Content: Fearless_One wrote: Sorry, wasn't sure where to put this.   Granted, I am not close to them (we don't live in the same cities),  "They", meaning my sister, my stepmother and my cousin.    They all wrote to wish mne happy birthday and asking about my health (it had been a few months), and I was glad to hear from them and told them aboout my surgery and the date and asked them questions about what was going on with them, etc.   That was almost 2 months ago.   I am not even mad, but it shows me they don't give a ****.    That is a HUGE surgery and the hardest thing I ever went through (although I am okay now).   I think if I ever hear from them again I will not respond.   Am I overreacting?  lump/chemo/rads/hyster-ooph/mastectomy/implants Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Fearless_One wrote: I had BLX/TE's Tuesday (prophy, no recurrence).   Oddly, my radiated side where I had a lumpectomy/rads a year and a half ago is doing great.   Much pain on my "good" side.   I take my pain pills in moderation because I hate them (nausea, loopiness, etc). He filled 400 on one side, 300 on the rads side.   Used alloderm (he says that allows more to be filled during the initial surgery).  Also, my foob doesn't look good.   I know it's a process, but were you displeased at first and then it got better?   I'm feeling very despondent and wondering if I made a big mistake.    lump/chemo/rads/hyster-ooph/mastectomy/implants Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Much pain 4 days post-surgery - is that normal? Fearless_One Fearless_One
